title: NEO-JAPONISM
subTitle: The crew explore Japanese design, delving into the craftsmanship involved, the individuals who perpetuate these traditions, and the fundamental philosophy that underpins it all.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Another Story
subTitle: Mount Fuji's bid for World Heritage faced formidable obstacles, including devastation that would shock any mountain climber. This is the story of Fuji's long climb to celebrated cultural treasure.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: Ultra-thin noodles and amber broth: the story of a people who overcame disaster and their favourite bowl of ramen.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Anime Manga Explosion
subTitle: Take a look at bones, the anime studio known for stunning action and works like `Gachiakuta' and `My Hero Academia FINAL SEASON'. Charismatic animator Nakamura Yutaka also makes his TV debut.

title: The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends
subTitle: Rockie and her friends compete to see who can pick the most berries from a tree. However, as Slinky is too short, he claims that it is unfair.

title: U & I
subTitle: A new student from abroad, u, comes to the school and meets with i. However, it seems like i somehow makes u feel a bit upset due to a gesture.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: J-MELO
subTitle: May J presents cocolashika, a trio with city-pop sound, and Utagokoro Rie, debuting with a major label after being known for her J-pop covers.

title: Little Charo
subTitle: The adventures of Charo, a Japanese dog who finds himself lost in New York City and decides to find his way back home.

title: Japanology Plus Mini
subTitle: In Japan, sweet potatoes are often baked or turned into sweets. But they can also be used to generate electricity or protect from heat. Introducing the diverse ways in which they are used and sold.

title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
subTitle: After arriving in Aizu, the crew meet two herb farmers' cats who live next door to each other, as well as the chief priest's four cats at Takeya Kannonji Temple.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: On the Wings
subTitle: Explores various sights and cinematic views of airports in Japan, including Itami Airport and Haneda Airport.

title: Core Kyoto Mini
subTitle: Kyoto City University of Arts was founded in 1880. Its educational policy emphasises `shasei', painting from life through intensive observation to glean a subject's true essence, continuing a practice advocated by 18th-century artist, Maruyama Okyo.

title: Easy Japanese for Work
subTitle: Learning work-place Japanese. This time, determining what is worrying a client. Lin Zhipeng, from China, works at a real estate firm. In a roleplay challenge, he must determine what is worrying his client.

title: Zero Waste Life
subTitle: Tanaka Ryosuke and Miyachi Yo use offcut lumber for furniture. Because using multiple boards can lead to uneven colour, they dye their work with indigo. Explores this clever idea and how it is attracting real interest.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Somewhere Street
subTitle: A unique walking-eye view of the greatest cities around the globe. Featuring chats with locals and enjoying encounters that only strolling the city streets can bring.

title: Time-Lapse Japan
subTitle: Okinawa Prefecture is a group of subtropical islands in the far south of Japan. We examine its past and present, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: US Influences.

title: Grand Sumo Highlights
subTitle: Sumo highlights from a range of tournaments that have taken place across the globe. Sumo is one of the most traditional Japanese sports and boasts a history going back more than 1500 years.

title: Sumopedia
subTitle: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Chatroom Japan
subTitle: Following a Brazilian woman living in Japan who is trying to promote a music video she made for kids about sexual abuse, all while navigating the differences between the two cultures.

title: IMPACTS:Climates Change the World
subTitle: Global warming has raised sea temperatures, increasing powerful typhoons worldwide. The program reports on their impacts and explores with experts the mechanisms and causes of their intensification.

title: Design Museum Japan
subTitle: Hara Kenya, a graphic designer, visits a Japanese propeller maker with a 30 per cent global market share to discover the value of finding the perfect shape of an object, without compromise.

title: Where We Call Home
subTitle: We meet Afghani Gulhabib Habiby who takes care of cattle on a farm in Kanoya, Kagoshima Prefecture, and Nepalese Rukesh Raj Giri who runs a produce store in Tokyo.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Time-Lapse Japan
subTitle: Okinawa Prefecture is a group of subtropical islands in the far south of Japan. We examine its past and present, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: Shuri Castle.

title: BOSAI: Science That Can Save Your Life
subTitle: Massive logistics facilities underpin online retail, but their robust warehouse structures, state-of-the-art seismic isolation systems and other features make them suitable as evacuation sites too.

title: Activate Your Japanese
subTitle: Lessons on how the viewer can make the most out of their Japanese language skills. This time, a look at how to broaden the viewers horizons.

title: Culture Crossroads
subTitle: In a stand-up comedy club in Tokyo, people from all over the world try out bilingual jokes. For James from Australia, comedy has changed his life, helping him find a place where he feels he belongs.

title: Hello! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
subTitle: NHK World-Japan introduces several of its programmes to a global audience, like special reports and documentaries. These programmes provide the world with a window into the Japanese station and offer the latest in Japanese news.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cinematic Journey
subTitle: Kyle Card hikes along the 621 miles trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japan, where he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

title: The Masterpieces of Ukiyo-E Producer Tsutaju
subTitle: Taking a close look at artist Utamaro's iconic work, 'Woman with a Glass Noisemaker'.

title: Seasoning the Seasons
subTitle: Visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of daily life, the cultural festivals that embody the nation's long history, and the distinctive culinary offerings that utilise the best ingredients the islands can offer.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
subTitle: Explores the history of Horyu-ji Temple, a World Heritage Site, in the Nara region and the Japanese social concept of harmony.

title: Time-Lapse Japan
subTitle: As snow melts in Yonezawa, it provides water that is used for growing rice. Beautiful time-lapse images show how a 400-year-old brewery turns this rice into sake, using human expertise instead of machines.

title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
subTitle: Japanese pond turtles are a near-threatened species. But a six-month tracking project revealed that they flourish in rice paddies, woods and fields. Take a close look at their surprising lives.

title: Time-Lapse Journey
subTitle: The Amakusa region has over 120 islands and is home to one of the places where a unique form of Christianity developed. A look at Amakusa's historic sights and natural beauty through time-lapse photography.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: Performers dress as monsters called namahage on New Year's Eve as a part of a good-natured tradition that strengthens family and community bonds. The tradition has also been revived in the village of Tayazawa.

title: Japan Delish
subTitle: The crew explore the history of yakisoba, a popular noodle dish enjoyed at festivals, and visit local yakisoba restaurants all over Japan.

title: Nun's Cookbook
subTitle: The nuns of Otowasan Kannonji Temple are cooking up a storm and inviting the viewer into their monastery to show them the correct way to prepare butterbur miso, also known as coltsfoots miso.

title: Hometown Stories
subTitle: Intimate portraits of people from around Japan, each leading diverse lives while enriching lives of others, with themes ranging from ancient traditions to contemporary social issues.

title: Sumopedia
subTitle: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: Learning about ritto and shosetsu, two important dates in early winter. The nuns teach the viewer how to make seasonal pickles and dumplings.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a look at Odachi, a giant sword that showcases a swordsmith's astonishing expertise.

title: Time-Lapse Journey
subTitle: A collection of time-lapse photography showcasing the beautiful scenery of Iwate, known as the land of sacred temples.

title: Where We Call Home
subTitle: We meet Afghani Gulhabib Habiby who takes care of cattle on a farm in Kanoya, Kagoshima Prefecture, and Nepalese Rukesh Raj Giri who runs a produce store in Tokyo.

subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

subTitle: Hiking along the southern section of the Michinoku Coastal Trail, Kyle Card sees local life, beautiful nature, disaster traces, and resilience.

subTitle: Hiking along the southern section of the Michinoku Coastal Trail, Kyle Card sees local life, beautiful nature, disaster traces, and resilience.

subTitle: We meet Afghani Gulhabib Habiby who takes care of cattle on a farm in Kanoya, Kagoshima Prefecture, and Nepalese Rukesh Raj Giri who runs a produce store in Tokyo.

title: Newsroom Tokyo
subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

title: Herbal Symphony
subTitle: Japan's oldest private herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture has a 300-year history. To pass this legacy into the future, knowledge of medicinal herbs is shared with younger generations.

title: Time-Lapse Japan
subTitle: As snow melts in Yonezawa, it provides water that is used for growing rice. Beautiful time-lapse images show how a 400-year-old brewery turns this rice into sake, using human expertise instead of machines.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Nakahara Sachiko talks about her work of translating the aesthetics of popular Japanese characters from comics and animes into live-action costumes.

title: Hit the Road
subTitle: Take a drive in Fukushima! 13 years since the disaster, see its rejuvenated community and daily life. Visit the rest stop emblematic of this resilience and sense the locals' unyielding spirit.

title: Japan From Above: Up Close
subTitle: A local farmer shares how he leads a double life at a salmon hatchery built around a natural cycle in the Shonai plains of Yamagata Prefecture.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: A group of anglers stand in a fast-moving, undulating river at the foot of a rugged cliff. They use drifting mosquito hooks to fish for a summer delicacy that was a favourite of the Edo townspeople.

subTitle: Taking a close look at artist Utamaro's iconic work, 'Woman with a Glass Noisemaker'.

subTitle: Erica Angyal presents approaches to treat periodontal tissue, including stem cell therapy and a device that uses hydrogen peroxide and blue light.

title: Journeys in Japan
subTitle: Kyle Card hikes the 143-mile-long San'in Kaigan Geopark Trail hugging the Sea of Japan in Tottori, Hyogo and Kyoto. The UNESCO Global Geopark showcases landscapes shaped millions of years ago.

subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

subTitle: In 2020, Kitajima Masaaki published the world's first paper on how the spread of COVID-19 could be tracked by monitoring wastewater. He talks about making an impact on infectious disease control.

subTitle: Explores Nara's herb scene in autumn, the harvest season, through a visit to Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden.
